attributes.action: boycott the Beijing Olympics due to the brutal crackdown by Chinese authorities on the peaceful protests in Tibet.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This repressive regime cannot be allowed to use violence to suppress peaceful protest against the Chinese occupation and suppression of Tibet.
China is hosting the Olympic Games and attempting to hide the brutal reality of the lack of democracy and the oppression of the Tibetan and Chinese people.
"One World One Dream" is the slogan of the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games and in the words of the Chinese authorities "It expresses the common wishes of people all over the world, inspired by the Olympic ideals, to strive for a bright future of Mankind.., we belong to the same world and we share the same aspirations and dreams."
Those detained for political reasons in China routinely face torture in custody in Tibet according to human rights campaigners including Amnesty International and the Free Tibet Campaign. 
These protests must be supported by those who can use their voice to support those who do not have basic freedoms and human rights. 
The Prime Minister and his government must boycott the Beijing Olypmics and insist on the release of all protestors.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
